|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| ![OpenVPN](https://github.com/lacework/ops/blob/master/openvpn-monitoring/icons/openvpn-logo-100x100.png?raw=true) | This overview shows concurrent users and connection time per user. As concurrent users reaches 80% of ${license}, the guage will turn red.

charts.name: SSL Cert Expires In
charts.description: Let's Encrypt certificates are valid for 90 days.

chartSettings.plainMarkdownContent:
These charts break down traffic flow, both send and received, per user.

Traffic metrics are in bytes/sec, converted to bps. 

The stacked area charts show aggregate bandwidth while the topk charts help easily show top consumers.

These charts are a high level overview of the OpenVPN host. These are basic host-level metrics from Telegraf. You can click on any of the blue charts to the right to jump to the Linux Telegraf Host metrics dashboard for a more detailed view of this host.

sources.name: Total
sources.query: 100 - avg(ts("telegraf.cpu.usage.idle", source="${host}" and not cpu=cpu-total), sources)

charts.name: Disk Free vs. Disk Used (Overall) Trend
